inn1.comm: wide, outside off and Naved-ul-Hasan slips and lands on his backside. It was more a case of his spikes not biting rather than any moisture on the surface
slightly wider and Vincent leaves it well alone. Signs that this pitch will be bouncier than we have seen lately
again wide and left alone
so far, Vincent he has not had to play at one
pushed into the covers for an easy couple. Nicely controlled and placed
Naved-ul-Hasan errs down the leg and Vincent clips it neatly to the man in the deep on the leg side
lovely start, beats Vincent's pensive prod
what a start! A straight one, Vincent aims a loose drive, the ball finds a big gap between bat and pad and send his off stump cartwheeling. A poor shot so early in the day
outside off stump and it swung away from the right-hander. No doubt that was a wide
speared in, beats Astle and a loud shout for leg-before ...  but sliding past leg stump
again in at Astle's feet and again it hits the pad, but this time no appeal as it was called no-ball
right up in the blockhole and Astle has to shuffle to dig it out
safely prodded into the covers. Great start from Umar Gul
straight line, Fleming moves across and steers it into the leg side
outside off stump and Fleming able to leave it well alone
much tighter but again Fleming shoulders arms. That will, however, raise a few doubts in his mind as to what he can and cannot leave alone
loose and slightly uppish drive, not in control and it goes behind square to get Fleming off the mark
Astle spars at it and plays it with soft hands along the ground through where third slip would have been
Astle again plays it in a  slightly jumpy fashion, hopping as he prods it into the covers
good ball and superb judgment, swinging inches past Fleming's off stump as he shoulders arms
seamed away from Fleming who started playing and then dropped his hands as the ball went past him. A good ball with real bounce and pace
attempted off drive squirts behind square on the leg side, Razzaq scurries round to field and throws at the bowler's end where Fleming would have been out had it hit
flicked off Astle's pads and an easy single into the leg side
another great piece  of judgment from Fleming as that swung in past his off stump
on leg stump, beat Fleming's attempted flick and a stifled shout for lbw
cut airily over the gully area and third man sprints round to field
pushed into the covers off the back foot
no sooner said than he is given too much width and drives one on the up through the covers, all along the ground
turned to square leg for a single
Fleming continues to display excellent judgment of what to leave and what to play
short by leg side, off Fleming's hip
Fleming shapes to pull but misses and the ball loops off his thigh to point
middle-and-leg line but Fleming misses an attempted leg glance. He should have done more with that
left alone outside off stump
Fleming left that on length as it flew over the top of his off stump. That shows he has faith in the bounce of this pitch
arcing across the left-hander, Fleming started to play but pulled out of the shot early
no such temptation this time and he watches it pass harmlessly by
good ball, no footwork, unconvincing drive which he missed by some distance
again an attempted drive/slash but once more his feet hardly move and he misses it
thumps into his pads and into the leg-side field
played away from his body into the covers. Astle barely moves his feet ... he must have a very good eye
and he proves he has by contemptuously swatting a short ball in the air through midwicket

this time Astle's lack of footwork proves his undoing as he tries to drive with a half-step forward, is not over the ball and the resulting edge flies into the midriff of second slip. Whatever Fleming said to Astle earlier in the over didn't appear to have any affect
neat drive through the covers, well timed and all along the ground. That underlined the difference that getting your feet in the right place makes
Gul overcompensates and Fleming smacks a short ball over wide mid-on
driven to mid on
left alone outside off stump
Gul again strays down the leg and Fleming clips it through midwicket
left alone, a decent end to a poor over
Fulton pulled out of the shot but the ball still struck bat and, fortunately for him, was steered along the ground to third man
jagged back in and strikes a jumping Fleming above the pad ... no chance of that appeal being upheld
same length but down the leg side and straightforward wide
pitched up and Fleming plays defensively
Fleming forced to hurry but jabs down on it in time

remarkable. Fleming shaped to hook, took his eyes off it and an uncontrolled top edge could have gone anywhere but it flew high into the top tier of the stands behind the wicketkeeper where it unfortunately strikes a spectator on the head
a tame end to the over as Fleming blocks
beats Fulton outside off stump ... he pulls out of the shot but after the ball has passed him
and the same again. The commentators are noting that Fulton has issues outside his off stump and the first three balls he has faced tend to indicate they are right
pitched up and driven wide of mid on
pushed to mid on and Razzaq makes a complete hash of a simple pick up and allows a single
slightly short and steered into the covers
jagged back into Fulton and a loud and confident appeal from Gul but Koertzen is having none of it
lovely line outside off stump, nibbles away and beats Fleming's groping bat. Tidy stuff
right on the money again, this time Fleming gets the full face of the bat forward to smother the ball
wicket-to-wicket stuff, cagily turned into the leg-side
blimey! Lovely strike, pitched up, driven on the up and takes the aerial route to the long-off boundary. Fleming's fighting hard for New Zealand
turned into the leg-side again, and this time picks the gap
outside off stump, and left well alone.
nicely driven through the covers, not quite timed and picked up just inside the fence
short and ducked. Fulton's content just to hang around
tight line on middle-and-off. Fulton shuffles across and prods the ball into the leg-side
handsomely driven, but not at all timed. Dribbles into the covers
beautiful pick-up and deposited through midwicket for a welcome boundary. Too full and leg-side from Gul, and lots of bottom hand in that whippy stroke. That'll boost Fulton's confidence
better line, and guided out to point
nice shape, bending back into towards Fleming's off stump. Pushed out to mid-off
tucked up a fraction by a leg-stump delivery. No alarms though
good shape and pace. Fleming biding his time against the new bowler
slightly wider outside off stump, but no stroke offered
leg-sided again, and again Fleming can't get it away. Good bounce and struck on the thigh-pad
end of a nice probing opening over. This one is back on off stump, and pushed away to safety
edged down to third man, you can almost claim he meant that - it was well clear of the slips
poor ball, on leg stump, tucked away to fine leg. That was a gift
in the air, and so nearly a catch! Fleming looking to impose his authority, and jolly nearly shovelled an attempted pull to mid-on. Razzaq stooped, but the ball just died on him
more watchful this time, dead-batted into the pitch
a bit of a yelp from the fielders and no wonder! This one cut back from outside off, and beat the inside of the bat, and the outside of off stump. Fleming living dangerously!
similar delivery but Fleming gets bat on it this time. Gul's round-the-wicket line is troubling him

the break in play has done the trick for Pakistan! Fulton goes, trapped half-forward by a good-length delivery. It pitched in line but maybe he was a shade unlucky as replays suggest it could have been sliding down leg. But due reward for Iftikhar nonetheless, who has started his spell very nicely
good swing and pace to greet the new batsman
lovely line, probing and swinging, and so nearly an edge as Styris is drawn forward
shorter, and pushed back onto his stumps. Defended
on the back foot again, and turned into the leg side
a bit of width outside off stump, and that's a confidence-boosting drive to get off the mark. You sense he wanted some proper bat on ball
nice start from Razzaq. Short and Fleming is squared up. But the edge flies safe and down to third man
good areas, Abdul, good areas
beaten outside off stump, whistles through to the keeper
oooh, nasty shot. Feet stuck in clay and bat wafting towards a wide delivery. Didn't get an edge, but deserved one
tucked away to escape the strike
full face of the bat, good stride, smothers the ball
clever shot, opens the face, uses the pace, and edges a good-length ball all the way to the third-man boundary
another play-and-miss this time. Shorter and tighter to off stump. Streaky stuff from Styris
defended off the back foot. At least he got good bat on this one
pushed back again, and defended into the covers
cagey stuff from the Kiwis in this over
strays onto leg stump and clipped firmly through the vacant square leg for a welcome boundary. That's eight runs off a good over from Iftikhar, and that's how the Kiwis need to play this
short and leg-side, played down off the hips
solidly forward with bat and pad together, and an easy two as he picks the gap on the off side. Nice percentage shot
shorter and beaten. Looked like an open face and an attempted steer to third man
nice languid drive, but can't beat the field
forcing shot off the back foot, slightly streaky as the ball flies through the vacant gully region. Cleaned up on the boundary's edge
leg-side, but can't middle an attempted flick
lovely seam position, and a fluffed attempted drive. Styris isn't looking at all comfortable
lots of clapping and shouts of encouragement from the Pakistan fielders as Iftikhar serves up another dot ball
tight on the stumps again, no room for manoeuvre
more width this time and Styris climbs into a handsome drive. But well intercepted in the covers
outside off stump, shoulders arms
perfect line and length, probing the top of off stump. Lovely maiden over
extra bounce outside off stump and Fleming is well beaten as he prods forward. Lots of oohs and aahs from the fielders
and this one bends back late and just clears the top of off stump as Fleming shoulders arms. Canny bowling
bat and pad together again, and Fleming scampers through for a single as point picks up and shies. Good running
back on his stumps, steered out to point
full and swinging, and a huge appeal for lbw! Looked closer than the Fulton decision, to be honest, but Rudi Koertzen believes it was doing too much
no run to finish.
driven in the air just wide of mid off and Yousuf dives and pulls the ball back inches from the rope
back on the right line
outside off stump and Styris not tempted to nibble
too wide this time and driven powerfully on the up off the front foot through the covers
good recovery from Iftikhar which Styris can't get away
driven firmly to mid off
good line, good length and Fleming can only block
drive intended to go through mid off, but the ball squirts off the edge square on the leg side
lovely ball that leaves Fleming in the air as he gropes for it
angled behind square on the off
slower ball, wide and getting wider which Styris half-heartedly spars at
worked with the angle behind square and long leg has a lot of ground to make up
driven with some power but straight to mid off
patted into the covers
turned straight to midwicket
slightly shorter and played off the back foot to cover
Fleming being tied down by some tight bowling. Again, he can do no more than pat this into the off-side ring
and as if to prove me utterly wrong, Iftikhar strays to leg and Fleming flicks it into the gap between midwicket and mid on
three-quarter controlled shot off the edge down to third man where it is well stopped
short, seams back in and Styris plays it off the back foot
full, driven to extra over
Syris shapes to flat-bat a short and wide ball through the covers but misses
slightly wider and Styris opts to leave it alone

driven to extra cover, an utter mix-up between the batsmen after a diving stop by Farhat  at point and Akmal had to hit the stumps from about two yards away with Styris floundering to get back ... and missed
blocked to end the over
steered to fine leg
paddled out on the leg side into  space
drive-push to mid off, no power in it
Fleming turned square as he pushes the ball back up the pitch
driven with more power, whipping the ball from off stump to mid on
punched to point. A good over from Iftikhar
wide and left alone
blocks a straight one. The loss of early wickets means that the batsmen are not going to take risks yet
text-book drive to extra cover who makes a text-book stop
paddled off the back foot into the covers. The game has gone a bit quiet in the last couple of overs
speared back in, a loud shout as it strikes Styris, but high on the thigh and Koertzen not remotely interested
flicked into the leg side, neatly placed allowing them to scurry back for a second to the man in the deep
straight on the button, Fleming defends
and now off the button as Fleming sweeps a slightly overpitched leg-side ball
Afridi pulls that one down but gets away with it as Styris defends
safely defended
no more than a soft-handed block but the lack of pace allows Styris to call his partner through for a nifty single
and Fleming defends to end a decent first over from Afridi
moves in off the seam and Stryis meets it with the full face of the bat
worked from middle-and-off to backward square leg
far too wide and Fleming launches a sumptuous drive through the covers to bring up his 45th one-day fifty
short, hammered square and Yousuf dives but makes a real meal of it having done the hard work to get there in the first place and the ball bounces over him for four
edgy drive into the leg side and this time Yousuf fields cleanly
edged - not controlled, a genuine one - through second slip and a third boundary from the over
correct forward defensive shot
Fleming again not tempted, quite happy to play each ball on its merits at the moment
more of the same
driven to the right of Afridi who makes a good full-length dive to stop the ball
clipped into the leg side
Styris waits and turns it square on the leg where the man in the deep chugs in to field
Naved-ul-Hasan looked very stiff and Styris thwacked a short and wide ball through the covers ... it deserved more than one
Fleming waited for that and placed it through the covers
Naved-ul-Hasan struggling to find rhythm and another single
still a bit too leg-side and turned fine for a single
if all else fails, bowl a fast bouncer. It works, and Styris forced to duck as it was too short to try a hook
smacked square but Hafeez makes a good tumbling stop at point
nicely flighted, and pushed away for a single
watchfully forward, smothers the spin
width, and big turn. Toe-ended cut into the covers
fuller and on the stumps, tucked into the leg-side
tighter line, nothing to cash in on
a lot rests on New Zealand's captain ... as ever
poor ball - too much width, and over-steps as well
that's much better, hounding the top of off stump, but squeezed away for a single
short of a length, and pushed back onto the stumps
slower delivery - that was a 62mph off-cutter, but well picked and tucked away for a couple
nothing doing this time

that's a beautiful shot to bring up the drinks break. Fuller and swinging, and perfectly timed through the leg-side. Bisects the two fielders converging at midwicket, and beats them both comfortably. Well played
scampered single, but makes his ground comfortably
bit of a whoosh outside off stump, but finds nothing but air
more belligerent strokeplay, and this time there's a single into the covers
New Zealand are looking to dominate Afridi, but he's bowling cleverly so far
a bit of a shimmy at the crease, and that's well played in the end, finding space on the off side
driven into the covers
that's a bit of a woolly opening, and Rudi Koertzen singles for an extra
better line and length. Defended
comes forward to meet the spin, and whipped into the gap at midwicket
Fleming sizes up a slog-sweep, but there's no need as Malik flings that one too far outside off
played off the back foot into space
turned into space. Another single
tossed up and turns as well. Fleming misses with an attempted square drive
too short and smeared into the leg-side. Fielded with a tumble on the boundary's edge
dropped into the off side, finds the gap and good running
tucked up on leg-stump
lovely strike - too short again, and effortlessly cut behind square for another four through third man
more runs now as Fleming takes the attack to Afridi, and wins.
and the end of a fine over for New Zealand, as Afridi drifts onto the pads and watches aghast as the ball whistles down to the fine-leg boundary
Pakistan are losing the plot a bit here. Too short again, this time from Malik, and Styris cashes in with a thumping cut through point
poor bowling from Malik, drifting onto the pads
ambitious stroke, down for the sweep and attempts to flick an off-stump ball over his shoulder. Doesn't connect, but that'll make the bowler think
better delivery this time
still too much width, dabbed down to third man
so nearly a run-out! Fleming had to launch himself at the crease to beat the shy from gully, and just made it
pressure being applied, and a horrible misfield gifts New Zealand two runs
urgent running from the Kiwis
and again. Good communication between these two
rapped on the pads, a big shout but the ball was clearly going down leg
on the back foot and steered into the covers

there it is! A flighted delivery on off stump, and Fleming can only shovel a tame return catch back to the bowler! A disappointing end to a fantastic captain's innings, and Pakistan have a chance to get stuck into New Zealand's middle-order
looped onto off stump from around the wicket. Nothing extravagent from the new batsman
down on the sweep and cleverly played behind square
back over the wicket to the right hander, who is tucked up by a sharp tweaker
firm defensive stride, smothers the spin
a bit of a shovel round the corner to this delivery, but it's reasonable effective as the batsmen hurtle through for one. Styris keeps the strike
a bit cramped for room as Styris sizes up the big shot
width, but can't beat the man at point
loopy delivery, turned into the leg side
that one looked like the doosra, and it was uncomfortably played
short and outside off stump, cut to deep cover
short again, and driven into space
on the back foot, steered to backward point for a single
good bowling, looped into the blockhole and dug out
quick single through midwicket, always a scare when there's a runner on the field, but Oram is home
another single through the vacant midwicket. New Zealand content to accumulate slowly
attempted flick, cannons off the pads
blocked with no fuss
steered into the covers
paddled to the man on the cover boundary and both fielder and batsmen amble through
no run, lots of noise from the keeper and bowler nevertheless
blocked with accompanying chirrups
good line, length and turn to end the over
flicked to midwicket
Styris tries a reverse sweep which, given his back problems, was a bad idea and he is clearly in some pain but he will carry on
Styris takes a big stride and flicks to square leg ... and then pulls lots of faces all of which indicate he is suffering
Oram uses his feet to come down the track and give himself room, lofting the ball straight and far into the stands
played and missed
worked into the off side
ugly pull off the stumps to deepish square leg
two steps down the track, chipped short of the man steaming in from long off
not one for the purists but a classic reverse sweep, fine and no chance of it being cut off
Oram is using his feet well, but ended up cramping himself up
nicely placed into the off side
short, smacked in the air through the covers, but although there was a yell of "catch it" it was safe
wide and slashed through gully in the air but it would have taken Superman to catch that
nurdled behind square on the leg
good old-fashioned slog over what schoolboys know fondly as cow corner where there is a large space
wide and short and Styris flat-bats it over mid off where once more there is no man out
a big swing but this time he hasn't got quite enough room to free his arms
slower ball, spotted and thumped to square leg. The throw is okay but the ball then gets flung from end to end and it could have been overthrows. A scrappy over ends in a scrappy way
lovely back-foot drive, waited for it and slammed it through the covers. Seven balls, 19 runs
Afridi appeals but nothing doing
a second dot ball will cheer up Pakistan
Oram misses a swipe but there is still a leg bye as it bobbles off his pads
big swing but Styris misses what would have been a heave to end all heaves
Styris launches another one over the top and into space at long on
a tad short , Oram slams that through midwicket with real venom and the ball crashes into the advertising hoardings with a real crack&

Oram aims a slash down the ground, the top edge goes high to third man and Umar Gul takes a good catch coming out of the lights and the evening gloom. Oram departs but his innings has really pepped up the New Zealand innings
good first ball, blocked
slashed into space. Razzaq has the wicket but he is hemorrhaging runs
Razzaq cleverly follows Styris as he tries to give himself room, the ball thunks into his midriff and they scramble a leg bye
McCullum finds a gap on the off side to get off the mark
gentle loosener, a single to Yousuf at midwicket. He is not saving the single and is not the best fielder, so no risk there
slog into the leg side where Yousuf again into action
very short, taken high above his head by  Akmal and after a long delay Benson signals a wide
tip and run into the covers
short but a lovely change of pace and Styris through the shot and almost taking a fresh guard by the time the ball loops past him
back to tip and run. Pakistan seem content to allow that at this stage
slashed in the air down to third man
yorker length, driven straight, half stopped by the bowler but a single as the ball trickles past the non-striker's stumps&
half volley as Iftikhar tries for another yorker and driven to the man on the mid-off ropes
flicked to the man at deep midwicket and Afridi picks up the ball and then doesn't release it .... McCullum spots it and calls for the third  and makes it. Poor, poor fielding
slashed to third man where it is well stopped at the second attempt
short and cut savagely over the covers
and special it is. McCullum opens his arms and hammers the ball over the long-off ropes

short and swiped to the man at deep midwicket where Naved-ul-Hasan misses it. He looks down at the ground much as a goalkeeper who has just let in a simple one does as if to say it wasn't my fault, it was a freak bounce. But it was his fault&

Styris gives himself room again and launches it into the deep but  Iftikhar Anjum takes an outstanding running catch above his head at long off to end an excellent innings. The wounded Styris limps off along with his runner, but his knockhas made a match of this
short ... too short and another wide
McCullum tips and runs, and Franklin has to dive to make his ground
Franklin turned square and an edge lobs down to third man
wide -  had he left it, it would have surely been called - but McCullum having none of it and he leans back and slams it over extra cover for a two-bounce four
up in the blockhole and squeezed out of the blockhole down to the third-man boundary. That's 33 from two overs and Pakistan falling apart in front of our eyes
great running. Banged down to the man two-thirds back at mid off but the fielder too slow and they ran two where they shouldn't have
into the same area but this time they are happy with the single
premeditated paddle-sweep but not short enough and it cracks him right on the elbow but, nevertheless, they run a leg bye to short long leg
Franklin heaves but can only bobble it to midwicket and an ambled single results
McCullum looks to give himself room and find the gap but Shoaib takes a good running catch about five yards in from the rope at wide long-off

dire fielding to end an innings where there has been too much of that. Short, it is steered down to Iftikhar at third man, but he is not on the boundary and it goes over his head and still bounces inside the rope

inn2.comm: Short and outside off stump, but big movement off the pitch
good movement again. Mills has been outstanding for the Kiwis so far in this tournament
lovely delivery - a full length and late seam movement, beats the bat
through to the keeper again, with that hint of nibble once again
reaching for this one, toe-ended into the covers
pushed back onto the stumps to complete a fine opening over
a good threatening start, short and climbs past the shoulder of the bat
good areas once again. Good pace too
and that's a ripper. Good length and explodes off the seam. Carries through to the keeper at head height
fuller length, squeezed uncertainly into the covers
bouncer and the first boundary of the innings! That wasn't controlled at all, short and hostile and top-edged off the splice, straight over the keeper's head
short and wayward, disappointing follow-up, down the leg-side
lovely strike. Too much width on a half-volley length, and eased all the way through the covers
good length and climbs into the splice, nurdled down to third man
pushed back onto the stumps, and a slight flinch outside off stump. Lovely attacking bowling
there's that excellent seam movement again. Bursts away off the pitch and towards the slips
short and wide, and slapped over point for a welcome boundary. It was a bit streaky to be honest, and Jeetan Patel nearly got a fingertip to it
eased down to fine leg, fielded on the boundary's edge
back on a good length, pushed back to the bowler
a big extravagant swivel-pull, but not quite middled
edged and dropped! A firm, flat-footed push from Farhat, and Fleming at second slip couldn't quite cling onto a low chance. It was into his fingertips and out again. Will that be costly?
attempted legcutter, but it's strayed onto the pads and clipped firmly to backward square leg. Bond is being expensive and unlucky so far
much better line and length. Six of those an over would do the trick
short and whistles past off stump at chest height
short again and wayward. Slight problems here for Bond?

that'll cheer him up! Short again, but tighter to the batsman, and Farhat's slashed cut gets a top-edge and flies down towards third man. Kyle Mills gets under it, clings on with a tumble, and Pakistan have lost their first wicket!
short and outside off, but Younis can't middle his cut shot
pushed back onto the stumps, thoughts of a single but nothing doing
back and into line
perfect line and length from Mills, who fields in his follow-through
and once again, no width and no run as Younis steers this one into the covers
full toss, but Bond gets away with it as Hafeez's eyes light up
much better delivery, good line and length, left well alone
on off stump again, and pushed into the covers. Probing stuff
that's a horribly loose shot! Not really there for the drive, and certainly not the windy whoosh that Hafeez opted for. Lucky not to edge onto his stumps.
excellent delivery to finish as this one cuts back into the batsman, but there's a squirted single available on the leg side. Good over
inside-edge onto the pads as Hafeez shuffles across his stumps
finds the gap in the covers
reaching for this one, and an expansive drive is the upshot. Can't beat the ring of fielders in the covers though
back of a length, dabbed into the off side, but sent back as point swoops
width outside off stump, and wildly slashed. Drops just short of third man, who has to watch for the spin as the ball pitches in front of him
much too short this time and that's a cracking back-foot drive that whistles through the gap in the covers. Solid stuff from Hafeez

two in two balls! Too short last time, too straight this time, as Mills strays onto the stumps and is sumptuously whipped through midwicket. Mills has lost his mojo after an excellent start to his spell
that could have been three fours in three balls, but Younis's cracking straight drive thudded into the base of the non-striker's middle stump. Unlucky
on the back foot, eased into the covers, excellent quick call and an easy single. That's the way to do it
no real rhythm as yet for Bond, but a dot ball will do
clattered! That was swift and brutish, and onto Hafeez before he knew anything about it. Got him flush on the grille! That's better from Bond!
much quicker delivery - into the 90mph realm now. But Bond oversteps
a quick single allows Hafeez to escape the strike. Probably a good thing for the moment
short, tennis-ball bounce, and Rudi Koertzen signals the extra
expansive drive, but misses out. An inside-edge bobbles off the pads
full and swinging and a vociferous appeal from Mills, but the ball was slipping down leg
wonderful flick of the wrists, and that sails handsomely over square leg and away to the fence. Great shot, and Mills leaks more runs
outside off and left alone
scampered single as the ball bobbles off an inside-edge and into the covers

got 'im! That's huge! Short and wide, a long-hop really, but Younis can only slap the ball straight at the chest of backward point, and New Zealand have the big breakthrough! Younis could have clobbered that anywhere!
dabbed into the leg-side to get off the mark, fielded at midwicket
play-and-miss outside off. Mills is visibly lifted by the wicket
well, that's an expansive slap down to third man, and an easy single. Big partnership this for the Pakistanis
onto the back foot, can't put it away. Tight stuff from the Kiwis here
now that's a cracking strike! Beautiful thump straight down the ground. If there'd been any pigeons there, they'd have been scattered
another boundary and that's a great little dinky back-cut - too short from Franklin, you can't put it there at his pace, and the ball races away to the fence
pushed onto the back foot. Better reply
pushed out to extra-cover
short and nothing doing
short once more but Yousuf over it and placed into the leg side

jags back and strikes him on the pads, a loud appeal from Mills but umpire Benson unimpressed and leg byes to third man result. Mills does a teapot and puffs alot but the ball was probably skimming over off stump
Mills fires one in straight and true
flicked off leg stump down to long leg
pushed into the covers, a passing thought of a single but extra cover is in quickly
nothing doing there as Franklin bangs one in
that hurts ... an inside edge right in the meat and two veg and he's bent over in pain. As usual, the fielders find it very funny but Yousuf not sure whether to laugh or cry
great comeback from Yousuf, driven crisply along the ground through extra cover
wide outside off stump and Yousuf aims an unconvincing swipe which he misses
into the off side and fielders converge
strangled appeal as Yousuf gets a thick edge into the leg side
unwinds at 77mph, on the button and played into the covers
cuts it in from outside off stump but left alone
Some confusion between the batsmen. The ball is returned to McCullum who spots Yousuf out of his ground and hurls the ball at the non-striker's end. Would have been interesting had he hit
once again Oram gets extra bounce - not surprising given he is 6'5" - and Hafeez spars at the ball, gets a thick edge and McCullum takes a diving catch wide to his right
Afridi forced to play from the off
wide and left alone
full toss padded to mid off
better length and played into the covers
shortish and pinged into Yousuf's body ... it is all he can do to push it into the leg side
lovely yorker which Yousuf does really well to jab down on and keep out
you'll see few better shots than that, a classical square drive to one overpitched and wide, all along the ground into the hoardings
mistimed drive goes nowhere ... after the Lord Mayor's Show
Afridi spars at one that maintaines its line and he misses
Afridi off the mark with an strolled single
left alone outside off stump
slightly shorter and Yousuf forced to defend on the back foot
leg-side line, Yousuf doesn't capitalise and it plops off his thigh-pad
beats Astle at point, but the man in the deep makes sure they only run the one
Neatly steered through the vacant second slip area where the man was until the last over. That got big on Yousuf and he did well to keep it down
fuller length and blocked
Bond bangs one in at 85mph and Yousuf plays an uncontrolled and unconvincing hook ... the balls loops into space on the leg side
Afridi takes on Bond from the off, launches into it and smacks the ball over the covers. Three men chase and the team retrieve it just inside the ropes
Circumspect defence
Anything you can do ... Yousuf leans back and smears the ball through the covers
banged in, Afridi top edges an attempted hook and the ball arcs straight to Bond at short fine leg  A buzz accompanied Afridi to the middle but he returned in silence
short, zipped back in and passes Shoaib at chest height
short and left alone
Malik spars at it with little footwork and hardly surprising he misses it
edged with uncertainty through third slip
Shoaib backs away and plays into the off side
angled across the right hander and left alone
a tighter line and he has to play at that
forced onto the back foot but angled under control down to third man
on the back foot, played down and it bounces through to the keeper and any thoughts of a single are quickly scotched
Franklin strays short and the ball is swatted over midwicket with contemptuous ease
good comeback in terms of line and length ... but not in terms of where his size 10 landed
good line and length and Yousuf blocks
worked into the leg side ... nothing doing. Oram is proving to be the star of the day so far
short and left alone. Oram is really hard to get away on this pitch, largely because of the bounce he generates
paddled into the off side
Oram errs to leg and Yousuf steers square
tight bowling and a chorus of encouragement comes form almost every New Zealand fielder
Shoaib forced onto the back foot. He gives a rueful smile
wide and goes on with the arm as Yousuf stretches to try to drive. The ball glistens in the lights, showing that the outfield is damp
better line
and once more Yousuf chooses to watch it pass by
finally Yousuf manages to find a gap with a straight drive to the right of Franklin
Shoaib tied down once more. He is growing a bit frustrated and needs something to feed on
and Franklin serves it up, wide and driven through the covers, across the dew-soaked outfield to the rope
outside off stump, Yousuf reaches for it, and steers down to third man
sawed him in half! That ball nipped back and could have gone anywhere! In the end it came off an inside-edge and flew away to the fine-leg boundary. They'll take whatever comes their way
outside off stump, Shoaib isn't tempted
still not tempted. And why would he be?
and another ball sails past unchallenged. Shoaib is content to rest on that freebie four for the moment
angled across the stumps, but squirted away for another single. Pakistan are ticking along
better length, watchfully defended
zippier and wider, a flashy attempted cut, but no contact made
on the stumps and whipped towards midwicket. Frankly, Franklin's a bit all over the place at the moment
"He needs to develop an indipper to be effective," pontificate the Sky commentators, and they've probably got a point
more leaked runs down to third man. This is all rather comfortable for Pakistan
an uneasy prod to a length ball that rises sharply. Squirted into the leg-side for a single
solidly forward to meet the bounce
short and well controlled with a roll of the wrists, as Yousuf pulls this one towards midwicket boundary. Swept up just inside the rope
pushed back onto the stumps, another single into the covers
again, a nice length from Oram, forcing a respectful response from the batsman
that's a sumptuous drive from Yousuf, right in the slot and caressed to the long-off boundary. He can win this match single-handed for Pakistan, and New Zealand know it
good flight and length, respectfully played
pushed out into the covers. Gripping the ball must be like a bar of soap out there
lovely flight and loop, keeping things tight so far
nothing for Yousuf to work with yet
now that's a shocker from the skipper. Dribbled out towards Fleming at backward point, who was utterly nutmegged and let the ball go straight through his legs. That ain't leading by example
and now Vettori himself is guilty, as he fails to intercept a return drive. Still, a good over in spite of the runs leaked
square driven and fielded at point
nice wristy flick to a good-length ball, another run on the leg-side
caught in two minds, didn't move his feet and wafted at a legcutter. Not very clever batting
fuller in length, Shoaib attempts an inside-out drive over the covers and fails to get anywhere near it. Luckily for him
turned into the leg-side this time, but still no way off the strike. Good work from Oram in this over so far
oooh, now that was close! A big nip-backer, and Shoaib all but chops onto his stumps. In fact, I was convinced he had, and by the furious look on Oram's face, so too was he. Cracking over
Vettori keeps it tight again
a bit of a long-hop, frankly, but Vettori gets away with it as Yousuf picks out the cover sweeper
aggressive intent, but long-off cleans up
beaten in the flight. Canny bowling, Yousuf might have popped a return catch if he'd gone through with his shot
pushed back onto the stumps this time. Good use of the crease by Vettori
width this time, but no way through. A tidy over to tie Pakistan down
draws the batsman forward, and fields in his followthrough
launches onto the front foot, looking for the big shot. But it ain't there
clipped off the pads
quality shot - that's the difference in class between these two batsmen. Shoaib wanted that shot, Yousuf achieved it, and beat the floundering fielder at mid-off
chopped behind square for one more
good finish to the over, full length, speared towards the pads
lovely loop and guile. Played into the gully
pushed onto the back foot, played back to the bowler
nice flight, good response as Yousuf picks the gap. An intriguing contest between these two
pushed into the covers
slack work in the covers as a tame drive beats the infield. New Zealand are taking their eyes off the ball a bit
turned into the leg-side
leg-stump delivery, pushed circumspectly to midwicket
leg-side again, but no big shots as yet. Deep square-leg fields
poor bowling from Astle. Leg-side again, and this one is flipped effortlessly through fine leg
long-off fields and one more to the total
that's a better ball! Skidding low towards Yousuf's pads and fended off with a hurried readjustment
and leg-side again. Pretty ordinary over, to be honest. New Zealand are in a bit of bother at the moment, for all that Pakistan are barely halfway to their target
slight hint of width, but can't beat backward point
that's the perfect line and length, and loop. Yousuf has no option but to defend
outside off again, and the off-side sweeper tidies up
pushed down to long-off for another single

this one is really loopy and held back in the flight, but Yousuf waits on it and eases through the gap to bring up a very impressive half-century. So long as he remains, Pakistan will win. If he goes, however ...
poor leg-side delivery to finish, and it's pummelled to midwicket for a couple
pushed into the leg side and Yousuf  takes on the arm of the man in the deep and makes it ...but only after a reference to the third umpire
short again, and flicked square on the leg side, but the fielder is in closer and no chance of two this time
neatly steered square on the off and again placement means they can run two to the man in the deep
pushed through and Shoaib slightly hurries as he drives it to long on
much tighter and Yousuf punches down to block
worked up to the man at long on. A good over for Pakistan and , importantly, pressure being put on the fielders
Yousuf stretches but can't get any power on the ball
pushed to point and despite the fielder slipping on the sodden turf, no run possible
uppish defensive push and despite a yell of "catch" from McCullum there's no chance of anyone getting near it
launched over cow corner where there is a big gap. A safe shot and one which breaks the grip Vettori had
cut and a superb tumbling pick-up and throw
plopped through the gap in the covers
Yousuf forced onto the back foot
short and half-paced, allowing Yousuf time to work the ball through square leg
tries to angle the ball to third man but Yousuf chops down on it and McCullum scurries round to field
better length and steered to extra cover
driven back to Franklin who, like all bowlers, shows more athleticism when his figures are on the line
flicked to deep square leg where Oram charges in to ensure there is no second
Yousuf takes three strides down the track but can only paddle into the leg side
Yousuf  waits and cuts through the covers
Shoaib uses his feet but ends up reaching for it and so doesn't get hold of it. It plops into the soft turf 20 yards in from the long-on boundary
intelligent cricket. Shoaib shaped to come down the track, Vettori fired it in short and Shoaib angled the ball fine past the man at short third man. Lovely stuff
angled again but this time with less power and squarer
intended loop over extra cover
Two steps and thwacked through extra cover. Super stuff
driven straight and Yousuf was off for the single immediately so he was almost home by the time mid off fielded it
speared into the body of Shoaib and the fielders are charging in before the ball has even dropped at his feet
cut at full stretch and Oram fields neatly at point
worked sweetly to third man
well bowled and no chance to get that away
played into the covers and VIncent makes full-length dive and in one movement he picks the ball up amnd hurls it at the stumps at the non-striker's end
nice line cramping the batsman
into the space on the leg
Shoaib  shapes to flick to leg, misses, but they still run a leg bye as McCullum scampers out to field
driven uppishly  to long on and Patel, on as sub, parries it on the bounce to save three runs
this time less excitement even though the ball ends up in Patel's hands again
that seemed to slip and ended up a widish full toss but Shoaib unable to milk it
driven  wide of mid off and Fleming slides to his left to stop it

a vital wicket for New Zealand and a real hammer blow for Pakistan.  Yousuf looked to drive but his hands slipped on the handle and the ball flew at thigh height straight  to Fleming who had moved round to wide mid off.  Fleming reaps the reward for the bowling change. Wily old dog.
wide and left alone
banged in and Razzaq ducks out of the way
a loud grunt from Bond shows he's putting in the extra effort. Blocked with ease, however
wide and smacked into the deep covers. No second there, although there might have been had the established pair still been there. But Shoaib cannot afford to get out ... he must be there at the end
placed into and through the covers
driven into the same space. Fleming won't mind that as the rate is above a run a ball
Vettori cramps Razzaq , following the batsman as he gives himself room to hit through the covers
and again he watches and follows the batsman
Razzaq drives up the ground to deepish mid off
really banged in, Razzaq swats as if the ball was a moth, but misses. That was in the mid 80s
Bond tries a slower one but the ball slipped and ended up as a full toss which razzaq was late to pick up. Razzaq blinked, showing he had found it hard to pick up
just on the legal side of being a wide on the off, Razzaq swipes and again misses.  He needs time to adjust to the conditions and that's the one thing he hasn't got
this time he gets everything behind the ball and just about gets it out into space on the leg
paddled into the leg side
Razzaq plays into the covers and thinks about a run, but it was never on
Shoaib attempts to run the ball down to third man but only places it straight to man there saving the one
flat batted through the covers, Franklin makes a sliding stop on the rope, and in fact takes the rope with him as he flicks it back. After a reference to the man up in the stands, it's a four
Shoaib finds the gap once more. He's getting runs but he has to get assistance from the other end
Shoaib steps a yard to leg and guides the ball into the covers
Razzaq does  much the same. It's not enough. Pakistan need a four off the last ball ...
Malik drives the ball to long on to bring up his 19th ODI fifty
intriguing stroke, short and angled towards the chest. Malik retreats and wafts in the same movement. Not very elegant
another slower delivery, short and pretty revolting, but Malik is hoodwinked and can only toe-end a slap into the covers. Smiles all round
that's a better line and length! Bursts past the edge and through to the keeper
retreats to leg and steers a short ball up and over the vacant slips. Experimental but not very effective
short again, and a top-edged slap - spiralling chance, but it lands short of third man

short again, but Razzaq is out! A flat-batted mow over the leg-side, but it's a comfortable catch for the man in the deep. Disappointment for Razzaq and Pakistan, but jubiliation for New Zealand, who must sense that victory is theirs for the taking now
slightly short and outside off, and slapped away for a couple
unconventional heave into the deep. The ball plugs as it lands and can't quite reach the fence
big intentions from Akmal, but he can't quite middle it
singles will do for the moment, as Pakistan attempt to regroup after the loss of Razzaq
another dab behind square on the off-side, quite a bit of turn for Vettori

and that could quite possibly be that. The last ball of Vettori's spell, and Shoaib holes out to deep cover! Beaten in flight, he got underneath an attempted lofted drive, and Astle took a fine spiralling catch. Pakistan in real trouble now
snorter! Short and hostile, and Naved is nearly decapitated as he ducks his head out of line at the last minute
fuller length, and watchfully into line
onto the back foot, and pushed into the covers. No single available, though singles won't do now for Pakistan
slightly short of a length, and swivel-pulled to deep midwicket
short of a length, dropped into the crease
excellent work by McCullum, who dives full-length to his left to intercept an attempted leg-glance

Rana Naved doesn't like it up 'im, as Corporal Jones from Dad's Army might have said! Short and aggressive, and McCullum takes a gloved pull down the leg-side. Good hostile bowling, and the end is jolly nearly nigh
on off stump, played and missed
angled into the new batsman, deflected into the leg side
firm drive into the covers, an excellent parry saves the boundary, and Akmal is back off the strike
bouncer, but too short
tight on off stump, edged onto pads
expansive drive, but picked up on the cover boundary. The rate is now up to 11 an over
finds the gap and at last Akmal has the strike
firm drive, but can't beat mid-off
short and swished into the leg side. Pakistan need boundaries, urgently
but instead of a boundary, that's another dot. It's all a bit futile now for Pakistan
short and carved uppishly to third man. But still no boundaries
oh dear, down the leg side and away to the boundary. A bit of a slack finish from Mills, but a good spell nonetheless
singles simply won't do for Pakistan. Stephen Fleming is already contemplating his semi-final tactics
full and wide of off stump, flat-batted to third man
turned to short midwicket, another single, but Pakistan are most welcome to them
and again. As the run-rate continues to climb
double the result for this shot, thanks to an over-enthusiastic shy from Lou Vincent. Overthrows are Pakistan's only hope. Six of them every ball
pushed onto the back foot. Good tight bowling
swished out towards deep midwicket, but there's no way though

well, that livened things up! The substitute Ross Taylor pulls off a blinding pick-up-and-throw from gully to ping the non-striker's stumps. Bob Willis, who has clearly been drinking too much of the local tea, sums it up thus: "It's not Rudolph Nureev [sic], it's Umar Gul"

and that's an emphatic way to finish! It's two wickets in two balls, as Fleming takes the catch that sends New Zealand into the semi-finals! Akmal gave himself room, and lollipopped a simple catch to short midwicket.
